body:
It may be unwise to try to pull data exactly on the full hour, because that is a point in time that is often chosen, for example for activities on servers (also unwisely, but we cannot help it).

In my case Adaway pulls data always exactly at 9:00 am, which is not a very good time anyway, because it is a time when people are likely to use the phone. For me, to give one example, some time in the middle of the night would be preferable. But please do not make it configurable. There is already far too much to configure on all smartphones. It should be automatic.

It would be much worse if many Adaway instances worldwide attempted to pull data at the exact same time, like exactly on the full hour. Perhaps this is so and this is the reason why Adaway takes such a long time to pull data, needlessly wasting RAM occupation, data, and battery.

There are various ways to make sure that data pulls are evenly distributed over time, but some simple random distribution over a few hours would already be a significant improvement.
title: Pulls data exactly on the full hour

body:
When AdAway is applied to the hosts file and music is playing over the headphone jack, every time there is one or more network requests made (and particularly when there are a lot of network requests made), the audio will glitch and stutter; it will stop playing and buzz for a split second, often repeatedly and of varying lengths.

It took a lot to determine that it was actually AdAway causing this, as I had no reason to suspect it over any other app. I diagnosed with a clean flash and reinstalling any root apps one-by-one.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Install Android 5.0.1
2. Root
3. Install Spotify / Google Play Music / etc.
4. Install AdAway, apply hosts
5. Play a song
6. Make network requests (e.g. load web pages in Chrome, load image galleries in sync for reddit)

This issue also goes away when the hosts file is returned to normal.
title: [Nexus 5] Audio glitching/suttering when hosts file is applied

body:
Sometimes a Host Source is unavailable.  In particular, host-file.net/ad_servers.asp is sometimes unavailable.

When a Host Source is unavailable, AdAway never times out, and just spins forever.  Android has to be restarted to get it out of this state.

When a Host Source is missing, may I recommend allowing the user to select 1 of 3 options:
1. Abort the update
2. Continue with the update, but use the existing local Hosts file as an additional temporary Host Source (this way, it minimizes the effect of a temporarily missing Host Source).
3. Continue with the update, but only use available Host Sources (this will result in some hosts likely not being blocked, and thus is not ideal).
title: When a Host Source is unavailable, AdAway never times out

body:
[Trove](http://trove.starlight-systems.com/) is high performance collections library for Java.

In this case Trove decreases memory usage of AdAway, but increases .apk file size by about 500 KB. I have not done any performance measurements of hosts sources processing speed.

Java heap allocated at the end of ApplyService.apply() after GC, with default hosts sources:
With Java HashSet and HashMap: 8.236 MB
With Trove THashSet and THashMap: 7.328 MB

@dschuermann as you are the maintainer of AdAway, it's up to you to decide whether to move from Java native collections to Trove.
title: Added Trove library for collections

body: After updating to a 4.4.4 rom on my Nexus 5, I noticed adblock was no longer working. I was able to download and apply a patched host file, but upon reboot the patching was reverted to the default hosts file. After tinkering I found that there was a second hosts file in /system/etc/ called hosts.og. It appears there is now a script built into 4.4.4 that renames the current hosts file to hosts.alt and copies hosts.og in place of the existing hosts file on boot. In order for adaway's patch to remain on 4.4.4, it must also patch /system/etc/hosts.og
title: Nexus 5 (hammerhead) 4.4.4 roms overwrite hosts file on boot

body:
I have a SIM free unbranded Galaxy Note 3 running firmware:
AP: N9005XXUBMJ3
CP: N9005XXUBMJ2
CSC: N9005OXABMJ3

I have rooted using Root de la Vega, and am running Super SU Pro 1.65.
I have also installed BusyBox 1.21.1 using the BusyBox Pro app.

I am running AdAway v2.8, downloaded from F-Droid.

When I first installed AdAway, I got a prompt for SU access, which I granted. 
I then did the following:

1) Click "Download files and apply ad blocking". The app crashed.

2) I re-opened the application and clicked "Download files and apply ad blocking".
    This time I got a pop up saying "Copying of host file failed".

3) I then rebooted the Note 3, launched AdAway again, and clicked "Download files and apply ad blocking".

This time it was successful, and the Ad blocks are in place.

However, when I try to update the hosts files, I often find that the application hangs completely, and eats loads of CPU. My battery drains very rapid, and AdAway cannot be killed using the normal Android task managers. If I look at SuperSU logs, all I see is:

AdAway @ 01/11 19:29
echo Started
Started

When I attempt to disable ad blocking, I see a message which says 'Reverting. Creating standard hosts file." 

This also either hangs forever (well, for more then 2 hours), or I get a message after about 10 minutes saying that the operation failed. 

I've installed aLogcat and enabled debug mode in AdAway. However, I cannot capture any AdAway related log messages. I've tried all of the log levels from Verbose to Fatal, and the only message captured says "D/AbsListView unregisterIRListener() is called"

I'd be happy to capture more diagnostic information, but would appreciate some pointers on how to configure aLogCat to capture AdAway messages.

There are some similar reports here:
http://forum.xda-developers.com/showthread.php?t=2475328
title: AdAway hangs or appears to crash when installing and reverting hosts files on Note 3

body: _Original author: MVadn...@gmail.com (March 13, 2013 12:47:57)_ What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Root the phone 2. Install AdAway 3. Update hosts What is the expected output? What do you see instead? I've been using AdAway for about a year without any problems. And I still think it's working exactly as it should. But one of the four default host sources (http://www.ismeh.com/HOSTS) has not updated AND is also listed as not having a local copy. I think what has happened is that when AdAway was last updated (on 3/11/2013) the existing host lists for ismeh.com was deleted in favor of a new copy from the site or by accident. But ismeh.com is down and since there's no local copy to fall back to, AdAway appears to be misbehaving when it's really just allowing through ads it blocked pre-update from the hosts on the ismeh.com list. The other three lists are dated: hosts-file.net: March 13, 2013 pgl.yoyo.org: March 11, 2013 winhelp2002.mvps.org: Feb 25, 2013 ishmeh.com lists 'not available' for both local and online lists. Trying to open that address on a desktop PC's browser produces: Site Temporarily Unavailable We apologize for the inconvenience. Please contact the webmaster/ tech support immediately to have them rectify this. error id: "bad_httpd_conf" Opening "http://www.ismeh.com/HOSTS" produces: Not Found The requested URL /HOSTS was not found on this server. Additionally, a 404 Not Found error was encountered while trying to use an ErrorDocument to handle the request. I believe that until http://www.ismeh.com/HOSTS becomes available or until a suitable replacement is found (like the last good copy) that AdAway will continue to appear to be malfunctioning when it's really a case of not having all the hosts to filter that it had before the update. Please enable Debug Logging in preferences of AdAway, install aLogcat and save a logfile while reproducing the problem. The logfile can be attached to this issue. n/a What version of AdAway are you using? What Android version? What custom rom? AdAway v2.2 (41) Android 4.2.2 HTC Sensation 4G / CM 10.1 Jellybean 4.2.2 [KANG] by albinoman887 Please provide any additional information below. Even if what I've described isn't the exact cause of the problem, one of the default hosts isn't working. If the dev has ay contact information for them, it might be helpful to send them a note about their site. Thank you for time, and for such great software. _Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/ad-away/issues/detail?id=413_
title: Missing HOSTS file after 3/11/2013 update

body: _Original author: stig.hac...@gmail.com (December 20, 2012 03:20:37)_ What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. use adaway 2. run an app that incorporates YuMeAndroidSDK (such as News Republic) 3. yume will try to prefetch ads every minute... --- What is the expected output? What do you see instead? there were no ads, so on that point ad-away's doing its job.... but perhaps here's an opportunity for a more subtle ad-suppression strategy that doesn't trigger such intensive background processing... ideally, the ad-fetcher could be coaxed into giving up without wasting so many resources... -- allow the connection to open, but hang it so that the fetcher winds up waiting for data instead of polling incessantly? -- freeze the thread originating the obsessive prefetch activity? -- warn the user that an app (that's still resident in memory, but perhaps not even in the foreground) is hogging resources because of adaway? ---- What version of AdAway are you using? body:
_Original author: Stebal...@gmail.com (June 18, 2012 01:36:43)_

The HTTP server runs on 127.0.0.1 but the HTTPS server runs on 0.0.0.0 making it world accessible.

The listening_ports option (blank_webserver.c:47) should be "127.0.0.1:80,127.0.0.1:443" not "127.0.0.1:80,443"

body:
_Original author: herbert....@gmail.com (May 14, 2012 10:56:22)_

I would like to be able to prevent getting notifications when AdAway cant connect. I use an app to disable data connectivity during the night when I am not likely to be awake to respond to something immediately. This has the advantage of significantly extending battery life. 

The fact that I have no data connection most the night means that every morning I have a notification from AdAway that it failed to update as it had no connection. A preference option to set AdAway to fail silently (not create a notification) in this case would be great. 

A more significant improvement would be to only try to do an update when a data connection is available. 


_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/ad-away/issues/detail?id=240_
title: Silently fail to download update

_Original author: infer...@gmail.com (September 29, 2011 21:36:31)_

The webserver feature is excellent, however its documentroot defaults to /.
Opening http://127.0.0.1 shows the entire contents of the device.

Although minor, it's a security risk and it would be much safer and saner to make a directory under /data/data/org.adaway and use the -r parameter to set the documentroot to this empty directory. After all, it's only purpose is to return blank pages.

body: _Original author: cloudsho...@gmail.com (September 27, 2011 19:38:01)_ What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.updating the hosts file 2. 3. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expected output is for the hosts files to be successfully parsed and merged. My outcome has been failed due to space requirements What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? 1.09 Droid 2 via Verizon, v2.3.20.A955 Please provide any additional information below. Using root explorer, I was able to move some files out of the /etc folder where my hosts file resides (after the file moves I had about 750k open in that partition. Before that there was around 240k available). I believe your program is trying to use the /etc folder to compile information. If this is the case, there just isn't enough free memory there to hold the downloaded hosts file, plus parse and merge. Maybe this can be rerouted to the sd card where free space is easier to make available? _Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/ad-away/issues/detail?id=81_
title: droid2 "not enough space"

body:
_Original author: lar...@gmail.com (August 08, 2011 16:16:55)_

set storage location to /data/data/
let AdAway update the host file
-> generic error message about filesystem possibly being read-only

it seems AdAway checks whether /system/etc/hosts was created properly but as the file was created in /data/data/hosts and no symlink was created (yet) that check fails

suggestion:
1. check the file that was created (so either /system/etc/ or /data/data/)
-> if file couldn't be read: error msg about read-only FS
2. if /data/data: check /system/etc/
-> if fail: error: "file written but no symlink existing"


_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/ad-away/issues/detail?id=37_
title: wrong error msg writing file to /data/data/

body:
I use this lists in my browser everyday.
I think that this app has become an general adblocker for an Android phone, and it musn't be focused only on games ads.

The default lists fom AdBlockPlus extension for Firefox are on line 99-103.
Lines 105-106 are a combination between easylist and Romanian adblock list.
Lines 111-112 are for site annoyances like Facebook like/share button from other sites.
If you merge this, I suggest adding in the default list only block 99-103.

Also, if this gets in PlayStore i would really really appreciate if you say this was my (bad :P) idea.

Thank you.
title: Added some other default host lists
